body.p: This chapter provides the brief introduction to the BTS User Interface (= BTS UI).
The BTS program window is split into four major sections:

The Menu bar and the Toolbar are located at the top of the program window. The area below them is called Workspace. The contents of the Workspace area change depending on the viewing mode. BTS has four such modes, activated by clicking a relevant button on the Toolbar:

Within each view there are sections with content. Different sections can be grouped into subsections (e.g. if they refer to one heading section). If there is more than one section or subsection in the same position, then they are grouped in tabs. Additionally, those individual sections or sub-sections can be dragged and dropped into other positions of the workspace or outside of the BTS program window.

li.p: Depending on the view selected, it can be called Corpus-, Thesaurus- or Lemma Navigator. The subsections are the following: for the Corpus Navigator: "Text Corpora" + "Bin"; for the Lemma Navigator: "WL" + "Bin"; for the Thesaurus Navigator: "Thesauri" + "Bin"; and for the Abstract Text Navigator: "Ths" + "Bin".

li.u: Annotation and Translation sections on the right
li.p: In Lemma and Thesaurus view the translation tab is not displayed.

li.u: Editor section at the center top
li.p: In Text Corpus view this section is called "Text editor" and contains three subsections: "Transliteration", "Sign Text Editor" and "JSesh View". In Lemma view it is called "Lemma editor" and has no subsections. Abstract Text view contains both "Text editor" with its three subsections and "Abstract text editor" section.

p.u: At the bottom the three sections are placed: Passport Data Editor, Lemmatizer and Hieroglyph Type Writer (HTW)

li.p: The Text Corpus and Lemma views display all three. Thesaurus and Abstract text views have only Passport Data Editor. Note that as soon as a database object is selected in the Navigator window, the titles of the sections Text Editor, Passport Data Editor, Lemmatizer and Translation change to the text name.

body.p: At the bottom of the program window the Status bar is displayed.
This manual uses the following terms adopted from the "Glossary of UI terminology" by Microsoft.

ul.li: Menu bar / drop-down menus / drop-down entry
Navigation tree / Node (an entry in a navigation tree, which can be a text corpus, text corpus object or a text)
